result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:20 AM   Defendant Kelly Ann Guzman not in court.  Attorney C. James Fitzgerald in court for Kelly Ann Guzman.  Prosecuting attorney Margaret Nan Ginocchio in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court orders warrant on defendant's non-appearance. Cash bond of $1000 set.  Court Commissioner may review.

Defendant to report to Rock County Jail by September 23, 2022 by 5:00pm.

3:51 PM Defendant Kelly Ann Guzman appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney C. James Fitzgerald appeared by video for Kelly Ann Guzman.  Prosecuting attorney David Zarwell appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Parties argue bond. Court orders Cash bond set of $500.00 with previous conditions: No driving without a valid drivers license or valid insurance. Maintain absolute sobriety. Defendant must wear SCRAM bracelet.
